result.execSummary:
The defendant Lacy A. TADDY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.
Under the Huber Law, concurrent with the sentence imposed on count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lacy A. TADDY

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody on probation hold.
GUILTY pleas entered to counts 1 and 2; theft and bail jumping.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 3.  Motion granted.
The Court sentences the defendant to the Manitowoc County Jail for twenty (20) days, under the Huber Law, on each count, concurrent, commencing immediately.
$323.00 court costs imposed.  Cash bail from 15 CM 84 applied.
Minutes.
RE: Defendant's withdrawal of plea of Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect.
Plea Date set for 10-08-2015 at 2:15 p.m., Br. 2.
Letter from Attorney Lambrecht to GLB.

Order to Seal.
It is ordered that the Wisconsin Forensic Unit Report performed by Jenna Hernke, Psy.D. received on 07-29-15 be and is hereby sealed by order of this court and shall be opened by the court only upon agreement of the parties and their counsel.
Report of Jenna Hernke, Psy.D.  (Sealed report located in case no: 14 CM 198)
From Attorney Lambrecht to Judge Bendix.

Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services.
Hearing is set for 08-12-15 at 8:30 a.m.

The defendant wishes to change her pleas from not guilty to one of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect on all charges.
The Court orders an examination and will appoint an examiner.
Minutes.
